intro: Adinandra lasiostyla, commonly known as the rough-stemmed adinandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, opposite leaves with a rough texture. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, followed by small, round fruits. Adinandra lasiostyla is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands.
